most_expensive_wine.title: Château les Ormes Sorbet 2013  Médoc
most_expensive_wine.description: This ripe wine shows plenty of blackberry fruits balanced well with some dry tannins. It is fresh, juicy with plenty of acidity, For a light vintage, it's perfumed, full of fresh flavors and will be ready to drink from 2017.

cheapest_wine.title: Felix Solis 2012 Flirty Bird White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
cheapest_wine.description: Tropical fruit and citrus aromas aren't bad, but the palate is heavy. The flavor profile only offers soap and grassy white-fruit flavors, while a light, flowery finish falls flat.
cheapest_wine.region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

cheapest_wine.title: Dancing Coyote 2015 White (Clarksburg)
cheapest_wine.description: Fruity, soft and rather sweet, this wine smells and tastes like apple and pear juice. It has low acidity, medium body and a sugary finish.

cheapest_wine.title: Terrenal 2010 Estate Bottled Tempranillo (Yecla)
cheapest_wine.description: Nice on the nose, this has a leafy note and a mellow red-berry aroma. Bouncy and rubbery feeling, it has easygoing flavors of raspberry and plum. It's candied and rubbery tasting on the finish, but good overall.

cheapest_wine.title: Felix Solis 2013 Flirty Bird Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
cheapest_wine.description: Berry and cherry aromas are surprisingly sturdy and clean. Freshness is maintained on the palate, which is honest enough to offer modest tannic bite. Lightly spiced plum and raspberry flavors change little on an easy finish.
cheapest_wine.region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

cheapest_wine.title: Cramele Recas 2011 UnWineD Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)
cheapest_wine.description: Notes of sun-dried hay and green flower highlight the nose and palate of this fresh, easy-quaffing wine. Concentrated tangerine and pineapple flavors are brisk and tasty.

cheapest_wine.title: Bandit NV Merlot (California)
cheapest_wine.description: A good everyday Merlot, dry and rich in tannins, with pleasant cherry, cocoa, licorice, herb and spice flavors.

cheapest_wine.title: Bandit NV Merlot (California)
cheapest_wine.description: There's a lot going on in this Merlot, which is likeable now for its rich blackberry, cherry, cranberry, cola and spice flavors. It's dry and balanced.

cheapest_wine.title: Broke Ass 2009 Red Malbec-Syrah (Mendoza)
cheapest_wine.description: Crimson in color but also translucent, with a candied, slightly green nose. Overall this is a simple quaffer with no excess weight and reasonably good flavors of berry and plum. Bland on the finish, but for $4 who's caring about finish?

cheapest_wine.title: Pam's Cuties NV Unoaked Chardonnay (California)
cheapest_wine.description: Sweet and fruity, this canned wine feels soft and syrupy, with sugary pear as the primary flavor on the palate. It's a basic white wine in a convenient package.

cheapest_wine.title: Bandit NV Chardonnay (California)
cheapest_wine.description: Packaged in a cute yellow recyclable Tetrapak, this easy Chard is sweet in pineapple juice and green apple flavors, balanced with crisp acidity.

cheapest_wine.title: Terrenal 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yecla)
cheapest_wine.description: This opens with standard cherry and berry aromas before transitioning to a juicy palate with red berry, plum, herb and grass notes. It finishes a little hot and aggressive, but for $4 who's complaining?
